_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Bonjour Tremblant!

With milder temperatures, 3 cm of fresh snow, and 96 runs open, the mountain is a true playground for anyone looking to have fun. Whether you’re carving groomers or exploring new terrain, conditions are set for a great day on the slopes! 

First Tracks: Access to designated lifts, on North and South side, as early as 7:45 am.

Terrain Park fans will be happy to hear that all 4 parks are open.

Alpine Touring is available today, with access to 15 sections across the mountain.

Wishing you an amazing day on the mountain with us. Have fun out there!

Mountain safety tip of the week: Be careful when using the ski lifts.
Knowing how to board ski lifts is essential to ensure the safety of all users.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: This Tuesday brings milder temperatures & 3cm of  fresh snow. First Tracks starting at 7:45 a.m. on the north and south side. 4 Terrain Parks and 15 Alpine Touring sections available for guests. The mountain is a true playground for anyone looking to have fun. Wishing you an amazing day on the mountain with us!
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Ce mardi, les températures sont plus douces avec 3cm de neige.  Les premières traces commenceront à 7 h 45,  tant du côté nord que du côté sud. 4 parc à neige, et 15 secteurs de Rando Alpine disponible pour les invités. La montagne est un véritable terrain de jeu pour tous ceux qui veulent s'amuser. Nous vous souhaitons une journée exceptionnelle en montagne avec nous. Profitez-en pleinement !
